User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user within the AttachFlow system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

role.description: User's role within the system (e.g., student, supervisor, admin).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user was last updated.

DailyLog.title: DailyLog
DailyLog.description: Represents a daily log entry created by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the daily log entity.

userId.description: Reference to the User who created the log. (Relationship: User 1:N DailyLog)

feedback.description: Feedback generated by AI regarding the content of the log.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the log was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the log was last updated.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project proposal or final report submitted by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the project entity.

userId.description: Reference to the User who submitted the project. (Relationship: User 1:N Project)

status.description: Status of the project (e.g., proposed, approved, completed).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the project was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the project was last updated.

Document.title: Document
Document.description: Represents a document uploaded by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document entity.

userId.description: Reference to the User who uploaded the document. (Relationship: User 1:N Document)

storagePath.description: Path to the document in Firebase Storage.

size.description: Size of the document in bytes.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the document was uploaded.

Skill.title: Skill
Skill.description: Represents a skill extracted from a user's daily log.

userId.description: Reference to the User who has the skill.

frequency.description: How many times this skill has been logged.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, support required QAPs (Queries are not Filters), and maintain data integrity using denormalization and structural segregation.  The structure uses path-based ownership for `DailyLogs`, `Projects`, `Documents`, and `Skills` associated with a user. This approach eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations and simpler debugging.  Authorization independence is achieved through path-based ownership, as security rules can directly validate `request.auth.uid` against the document's location without needing to read parent documents. Structural segregation is applied by storing different entities (users, logs, projects, documents, skills) in separate collections with homogeneous security postures.
